page.title: 04LAND USAGE
page.content:
{LAND USAGE}
The villages of Trefonen,Treflach and Nantmawr are mainly farming areas.At one time they were quite industrial, that was when the coal_mines and the quarries were in use.They quarried stone and lime.There used to be a coal mine at Trefonen but it is no longer in use.Many of the mounds seen in the fields are old spoil heaps and the coal board still has some parts of the parish marked on it's map as possible sources of coal.Some of the larger quarries are still working like ARC. There is one between Treflach and Trefonen that is now used by the council as a tip and as storage for salt and grit to put on the roads in the winter.
